node.title: The weight of a nation's relief hangs heavily on Cleo and her family
node.alt: A mother holds a little girl in her arms
node.description: No one wants to be that helicopter parent. ButÂ then little Cleo is snatched and your carefully constructed, self-confident world falls in, writes Virginia Trioli.
node.content:
["No one wants to be that helicopter parent.\u00a0", "The one anxiously peering from the gate as your child freewheels away on their bike, just as they should.", "You remind yourself of the entire days you spent as a child away from your home, so far from your parents' view. You were told to be \"back home in time for tea\" and most often not even asked how spent your day.", "As kids, my older brothers played in the old quarry behind our house. Let me repeat that \u2014 an abandoned quarry: a place of holes so abysmal they could swallow a child for all time.", "No one wants to be the parent worrying about a stranger danger so rare that crime figures still show a child is always more at risk from someone they know.", "And then little Cleo is snatched and your carefully constructed, self-confident world falls in.", "", "
Sad little ghosts\u00a0must have come rushing back to so many with the disappearance of Cleo Smith.(Unsplash:\u00a0Xavier Mouton)
", "
The stories that haunt us
", "We all have our formative experience of first learning of childhood kidnapping.", "I grew up with the story of Eloise Worledge, taken from her bed in Beaumaris in 1976 and never found. I had dreams about her. I can see her face in my mind at any moment.", "Generations of childhoods in Adelaide have been defined by the story of the missing Beaumont children.", "The sad little ghosts of those histories must have come rushing back to so many a little less than three weeks ago.", "You can tell yourself that it's rare, but that won't always help: the fear of the stranger is deeply embedded.", "A little over a year ago, I wrote here about another child lost and found\u00a0and the desperately needed good news\u00a0when little William Callaghan was rescued in similarly hostile terrain. The jubilation at his safe recovery was the same kind of universal relief expressed for Cleo: it was as if the country exhaled, finally, and all at once.", "But something about the celebrations that attended this brilliant success story was troubling.", "Sarah Krasnostein, author of the profoundly moving book\u00a0The Trauma Cleaner, found the words to say it. On social media this week she was worried and exasperated at the repeated references to a smiling and \"well\" child; to a girl who was making everyone else so happy by seeming to be so happy herself:", "\"The fact that a deeply traumatised child is described as \"bubbly\", \"sweet\", \"just delightful\" to satisfy a collective need for a magically redemptive narrative is disturbing.\"", "She went on to argue that this framing accords with a history of how we un-see trauma and just expect kids to \"get over it\". She saw it as \"dangerous public health messaging.\"", "I could see what she meant. It was clearly so desperately important to us, and of course, I imagine, most of all to those who love this little girl that she be OK.", "But I had so many listeners who felt the same, sternly asking me to stop reporting that she was \"well\": how could a little girl snatched from her family and hidden for almost three weeks be well? Her trauma, they worried, was just beginning.", "", "
The interest in this case has been deep.(ABC News: James Carmody.)
", "
We understand trauma better now
", "Just as disturbing for me was the media call at which WA Premier Mark McGowan happily told of how he had met the family and the little girl, giving her a teddy. The well-intentioned Premier clearly had the family's best interests at heart, but more strange men and more gifts and more attention for the little girl?", "I wanted everyone \u2014 including my colleagues in the media \u2014 to just clear off and leave them alone.", "But because of incredible work done by many professionals, and writers like Krasnostein too, our understanding of trauma \u2014 its complexity, its long shadows \u2014 is so much greater. The careful, subtle work of\u00a0 reconnecting this girl to her world and to her own sense of agency will be well underway, and Sarah is right: none of it is being done for our gratification. The story is a terrifying one, and we are going to have to find our own ways of managing our terror.", "I suspect family-sized tents are going to fly out the camping shop doors this summer. The response might be irrational, but utterly understandable: there will no children's tent this year. We will sleep in sweaty piles, our children clutched close to us.", "This weekend, you can reflect on the staggering housing bubble and its intergenerational consequences, spend some time with the enigma that is Jana Pittman and have your heart swell with pride at the lifework of the Prime Minister's Science Prize winner, Eddie Holmes.", "Have a safe and happy weekend and thank you to Radiohead for keeping small gifts in their pockets to hand over to us at just the right moment.", "Time is going to be very, very kind to Thom Yorke's rock-art outfit, and the forgotten or neglected tracks of their expanded reissue, KID A MNESIA, prove the point. The passage of time has been their friend. Here's one of their lost masterpieces \u2014 I think it's beautiful.\u00a0", "Virginia Trioli is presenter on Mornings on\u00a0ABC Radio\u00a0Melbourne and the former co-host of\u00a0ABC\u00a0News Breakfast."]
